nodes.text: Bantha Tracks was a location in the marketplace of Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. Blue milk was available there for purchase, with the milk being sold to the location beforehand from the Saka Homestead located just on the outskirts of the outpost.

This location was first mentioned on a promotional trading card for Disney's Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge park area released during the Galactic Nights event on December 16, 2017. The Saka Homestead map card states blue milk can be found at Bantha Tracks in the marketplace. Another card, called "BLUE MILK DELIVERED FRESH FROM THE FARM," depicted a male human delivering containers of blue milk to a market stand.

Though the card suggested a connection between Saka Homestead and the blue milk at Bantha Tracks, the theme park does not have a location with that name. Blue milk is instead sold at the Milk Stand which also offers a Bubo Wamba Family Farms souvenir drink vessel, and the stand's in-universe owner is Bubo Wamba. The Black Spire Outpost map which is available with the Barnes & Noble Exclusive Edition of Galaxy's Edge: Black Spire does not contain the names "Bantha Tracks" or "Saka Homestead," but still includes the illustration of banthas. It is unknown if these all represent different locations or a change in the naming of the stand and farm before the park's opening.
Bantha Tracks is also the name of a well known Star Wars fan newsletter.
